Isco's standing with Solari will be defined on Saturday

Solari's selection choice for Eibar will define Isco's postion as either an undisputed starter or an expandable bench warmer.

Since the arrival of Santiago Solari, Isco has lost his starting place at Real Madrid. Not only has he not started any of the four games since the Argentinean coach took charge, but he has had fewer minutes (51’) than any other player, except Fede Valverde (44’).

When asked about the situation of the Spanish international before the game against Celta Vigo almost two weeks ago, Solari said that he still had not recovered his fitness following surgery for acute appendicitis that had kept him side-lined for one month.

"We know his quality and how special he is in his position. We know all it. He is training to get himself in top shape. It's true that he just came out of a delicate operation and it's not easy to be 100 percent,” said the Madrid coach.

Varane penalty on Suárez: what was said by referee and VAR


Barça's second goal in El Clásico was a VAR awarded penalty, and thanks to new refereeing transparency, we now know what was said in that decisive conversation.

Varane-Suárez penalty: the VAR decision

On October 28, Barcelona ran out 5-1 winners over Real Madrid in the first Clásico of the season. Their second goal came courtesy of a penalty, after Raphael Varane was deemed to have fouled Luis Suárez in the area. Although the referee didn't immediately point to the spot, the intervention of the Video Assisant Referee (VAR) proved decisive.

Now, thanks to the referees' association, we have been allowed to hear the conversation that took place between on-field referee, José María Sánchez Martinez, and the man in the box, Alejandro José Hernández Hernández. This is how it transpired.

Sánchez Martinez: "Correct, correct. For me he played the ball."

Hernández Hernández: "Don't restart anything." (Note: if the game restarts the ref cannot go back to review the incident).

SM: "Offside, offside."

HH: "Don't restart, please. Don't restart. Listen to me. You told me that you think he played the ball, right?"

SM: "Yes."

HH: "Don't restart."

SM: "OK, perfect."

SM: (to the Barça players): "Go away, go away. Stay calm."

Busquets: "Is it a penalty to Suárez?"

SM: "Calm down, Sergio. It's not down to what you want. We are working on it [the decision]. Come on, stay calm."

HH: "José María, please, I advise you to go and look at it."

SM: "OK, perfect."

HH: "Varane didn't touch the ball. He kicked Luis Suárez."

SM: "Let me look at the play..."

HH: "Here you have it. There you go..."

SM: "OK. I see the contact. For me it's right... Perfect. Yes, penalty. Perfect, without card."

HH: "Perfect. Correct, José María."

SM: No booking."

The penalty was then awarded, pleasing one set of players and fans, while infuriating many of the others, and Luis Suárez stepped up to score the first goal of his hat-trick.

Benzema: "Now Cristiano's not here it's up to me to supply the goals"


Karim Benzema spoke to Real Madrid TV about his role: "Now I'm more alone up front and when crosses are put in, I have to be first to them. That's what's changed".

Karim Benzema was interviewed on Real Madrid TV's La Tertulia Magazine this evening. The French striker was joined on set by former team mates Xabi Alonso and Álvaro Arbeloa. Xabi is now coaching Madrid's Under-16s while Arbeloa is also back at the club as an ambassador.

Moment of form: “I feel really happy and comfortable at this club, I hope it continues that way”.

Feeling good

You certainly look happy out on the pitch: “I'm always happy out on the pitch because having a ball at my feet is what makes me feel good. And when I am scoring goals and setting them up for my team mates, I'm even happier”.

Ten goals so far this season: “I feel good, you can tell by how I am out on the pitch. I'm at a good level, I feel strong, motivated and full of ambition. This is a very important season for all of us. I think we're better now, we're playing as a team, defending and attacking together and we're having more luck in front of goal than before".

You're always being asked to step forward and lead the team: "They always ask me for more. Madrid is the best club in the world. Everyone always wants more from a striker - more goals, more touches, more assists, it's normal. I'm more motivated than ever to make it a great year for us".

https://en.as.com/en/2018/11/22/football/1542918711_664076.html?autoplay=1

Benzema: "My goal against Karius wasn't as easy as it looks"

During his interview with Real Madrid TV, the French striker was asked about his decisive goal against Liverpool in the Champions League final.

During an extensive interview with Real Madrid TV which was broadcast on Thursday night, Karim Benzema was asked about his opening goal in the Champions League final against Liverpool which proved decisive in helping Zidane's team lift the Duodécima. Loris Karius didn't appear to spot the Frenchman lurking as he attempted to roll the ball out of the Liverpool area. Quick-thinking Benzema took a chance and stuck out his right foot - making contact with the ball to send it bobbling towards goal and inside the post.

Benzema pounces

Joined on set by Xabi Alonso and Álvaro Arbeloa - curiously, both former Liverpool players, Benzema recalled his big moment in Kiev - one which Karius is undoubtedly still having nightmares about. “The goal? It wasn’t just about that for me. I think that was probably one of the best games I have ever played for Real Madrid – in terms of possession, first touch of the ball, dribbling, shooting… everything. And that goal isn’t as easy to score as it might appear on television. A lot of people might think it’s easy but it isn’t because it requires a lot of attention and anticipation. For me, a striker needs to be able to anticipate situations like that”.

https://en.as.com/en/2018/11/22/videos/1542925821_041619.html?autoplay=1

Hierro: “Lopetegui is a great coach, he needed time"


The ex-Real Madrid player has defended former colleague Lopetegui, saying: "It was not easy to come into a team that has won the last three Champions Leagues."

Former Real Madrid star Fernando Hierro gave his thoughts in an interview with Radio Napoli in Italy this Thursday, in which he spoke about life at the Bernabéu post Ronaldo and ex-Spain colleague and recently sacked Madrid coach, Julen Lopetegui.

Hierro was Spain’s director of football when he was unexpectedly cast into the role of head coach for this summer's World Cup, after Lopetegui was fired for announcing he had accepted the Real Madrid job just days before the start of the tournament.

In hindsight it now may seem like an ill-fated decision for Lopetegui, who was relieved of his duties at the Bernabéu at the end of October after overseeing Real Madrid’s worst start to a season in its history. But former colleague Hierro believes he is an excellent coach, despite his misfortunes during his brief spell at Madrid.

"It is very difficult to talk about a colleague by profession, whom I spent a lot of time working with,” Hierro told Radio Napoli. “Possibly, like every coach, he needed time, tranquillity. It was not easy to come into a team that has won the last three Champions Leagues. Of course, Julen is a great coach and I do not have any doubt about that."

Benzema: "Now Cristiano's not here it's up to me to supply the goals"


Karim Benzema spoke to Real Madrid TV about his role: "Now I'm more alone up front and when crosses are put in, I have to be first to them. That's what's changed".

Karim Benzema was interviewed on Real Madrid TV's La Tertulia Magazine this evening. The French striker was joined on set by former team mates Xabi Alonso and Álvaro Arbeloa. Xabi is now coaching Madrid's Under-16s while Arbeloa is also back at the club as an ambassador.

Moment of form: “I feel really happy and comfortable at this club, I hope it continues that way”.

Feeling good

You certainly look happy out on the pitch: “I'm always happy out on the pitch because having a ball at my feet is what makes me feel good. And when I am scoring goals and setting them up for my team mates, I'm even happier”.

Ten goals so far this season: “I feel good, you can tell by how I am out on the pitch. I'm at a good level, I feel strong, motivated and full of ambition. This is a very important season for all of us. I think we're better now, we're playing as a team, defending and attacking together and we're having more luck in front of goal than before".

You're always being asked to step forward and lead the team: "They always ask me for more. Madrid is the best club in the world. Everyone always wants more from a striker - more goals, more touches, more assists, it's normal. I'm more motivated than ever to make it a great year for us".

James future not a priority for Bayern Munich - Rummenigge

The Colombian reportedly wants a return to the Bernabeu, but the German giants are in no rush to make a decision on his future

"In our agreement we have an option that we can make use of until 15th June 2019. We are having November now so I don't think it makes sense to speak about it now already," the Bayern chairman said on Thursday.

"I am of the opinion that James played great football last season. He was one of our best players as far as I remember.

"The game in Madrid [in the Champions League in May] he scored the 2-2 and then all the Madrid fans were applauding him."

'Rashford will be considering Real Madrid move' - Man Utd exit possible, says Berbatov

Dimitar Berbatov believes Real Madrid rumours will have turned Marcus Rashford’s head and have the Manchester United forward thinking “f*ck it, why not?”.

Former United striker Berbatov believes a move could be made, telling Betfair: “I wasn't totally surprised to see rumours about Marcus Rashford moving away from Old Trafford.

“I think Jose Mourinho should be playing him more; he's only going to get better with experience and we can see how well he is playing for the national team.

“Rashford hasn't necessarily hit top form for Man United so far this season, but he is a good player with a big future ahead of him.

“If he is not happy with the lack of playing time, I can understand why he might start thinking about his options.

“I would be very sad to see him leave and Manchester United need to do all they can to keep him, but you can see why players head get turned when names like Real Madrid are mentioned.

“Madrid isn't a place where he is necessarily going to get more playing time, of course, but when you are bit confused, you sometimes forget about those details and can get seduced by the big name. You think 'f**k it, I'm not getting a chance here, so why not?'

“But, as I said, I do not want this move to happen.

James: Juventus, Mendes discuss Colombian in Milan meeting

Jorge Mendes was in Italy on Wednesday for talks over the future of three players potentially on their way to Juve, says Tuttosport.

James and De Gea also on the agenda...

Meanwhile, Tuttosport says the two parties also took advantage of the meeting to discuss potential summer deals for two further Mendes clients, James Rodríguez and David de Gea.

With De Gea out of contract at Manchester United in June, the Spanish goalkeeper would arrive at Juve on a free, while James must wait and see whether Bayern Munich opt to make his two-year loan from Real Madrid permanent.

Bayern have a 42m-euro purchase option on James and, despite reports they've chosen not to keep him, club CEO Karl-Heinz Rummenigge said on Thursday that the Germans are yet to make a final decision on his future.

Official Announcement

With regards to the reports published by Der Spiegel in relation to our captain, Sergio Ramos, the club wishes to express the following:

1. Sergio Ramos has never breached anti-doping regulations.

2. UEFA requested specific information and immediately closed the case referred to, as is customary in such instances, following tests carried out by experts from the World Anti-Doping Association (WADA) and UEFA itself.

3. In terms of the rest of the content published by the aforementioned publication, the club will not be making any comment, given the clearly insubstantial nature of the reports.

Solari: Real Madrid have to improve certain things

After suffering his first defeat in his first game as Real Madrid's permanent coach, Santiago Solari faced the press to comment on a 3-0 loss to Eibar.

"We weren't good and we accept that, we have to work to improve and correct the mistakes," Solari admitted to beIN LaLiga.

"They were very good, it worked for them and we have to congratulate Eibar.

"Of course it's a hard result, we didn't expect it, and we have to work to improve and adjust certain things that we didn't do well, but they're perfectly remediable."

Ramos: "When you don't show attitude, this is what happens"

The captain was self critical after this afternoon's defeat at Eibar: "Football is about results and when you don't match your rivals for intensity, you pay the price".

After this afternoon's defeat to Eibar, Sergio Ramos came out to face the music with the media in the mixed zone. The Real Madrid captain was critical about his own performance and insist in his case it's not a physical problem. "Football is about results and when you don't match your rivals for intensity, you pay the price".


Painful defeat: "We're annoyed. The idea was to reduce the distance with the teams at the top of the table and now we're further behind. We've turned into a crude team. I congratulate our rivals because they knew how to take advantage. We need to be self critical. We were not at the required level today and there are no excuses. In the top flight, you need to be at the maximum level to be able to compete. If you don't match your opponent in drive, intensity and rhythm, you get punished like we were today".

Look over what went wrong with a cool head

The opening goal: "When you get a negative result, you can enter into a negative dynamic. Today, we allowed our heads go down - now we have to take a look at what went wrong".

The 'Solari Effect' comes to an end: "We can't make an assessment in the heat of the moment, we need to take a step back and calmly analyze what we did badly. When you don't show attitude, everything becomes much harder".

Quality in the squad: "The squad is what it is, with the players we have".

Spanish anti-doping agency responds to Ramos reports

Following allegations made against Real Madrid captain Sergio Ramos, Spain's anti-doping agency AEPSAD has sought to clarify its stance.

Spain's anti-doping agency AEPSAD has stated it only opens disciplinary proceedings "when it has sufficient evidence of a possible anti-doping rule violation" following allegations made against Real Madrid captain Sergio Ramos by German publication Der Spiegel.

The claims, which are based on documents purportedly obtained by whistleblowers Football Leaks, suggested Ramos had broken anti-doping protocol on two occasions.

Real Madrid have issued a statement insisting Ramos has never breached such rules, while UEFA "strongly and categorically refuted unfounded allegations it has covered up positive doping results", in relation to accusations the Spain defender gave a sample containing traces of a forbidden substance after the 2017 Champions League final against Juventus.

The second claim made by Der Spiegel alleges Ramos knowingly broke anti-doping rules by showering prior to providing a sample after the LaLiga game against Malaga in April 2018.

The newspaper says the case was handled by AEPSAD and, in its response to the reports, the organisation sought to clarify is position, although Ramos was not referenced specifically in the statement.

AEPSAD's statement read: "Given the numerous inquiries from the national and international media, the Spanish Agency for the Protection of Health in Sport (AEPSAD) reports the following:

"The Spanish anti-doping legislation expressly prevents this Agency from making public any information about the content of disciplinary proceedings or reserved proceedings carried out in the framework of investigations in the event of possible infringements of anti-doping regulations.

"AEPSAD only proceeds to the opening of disciplinary proceedings when it has sufficient evidence of a possible anti-doping rule violation, otherwise AEPSAD does not proceed with the opening of disciplinary proceedings."

The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) said: "We were not aware of this matter and we will contact the relevant testing authority (AEPSAD) for more information."

In their own statement, addressing allegations beyond the Champions League final claims, Real Madrid said: "Regarding the rest of the content from the aforementioned publication, the club does not pronounce itself before the evidence of its insubstantial nature."

Which Real Madrid players had a poor attitude during the Eibar loss?


Real Madrid fell to a 3-0 defeat at Eibar on Saturday afternoon and Sergio Ramos believes a lack of attitude was one of the causes.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/11/24/5bf9838e268e3e40088b45d4.html

Nobody is leading the way at Real Madrid


Fragile, weak and without any capacity to respond, not in the first minute or after the break, not when Eibar were scoring goals thanks to their dominance, better game and, especially, outstanding attitude from the start until the end of the match. The consequence was a fresh defeat and a return to a very recent past, that pushed the embarrassment limits of Real Madrid fans.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/opinion/2018/11/24/5bf98d66268e3e974d8b45ea.html

Real Madrid's blue and red nightmare


Eibar won against Real Madrid at Ipurua on Saturday, but the Basques aren't the only team wearing blue and red to have won against Los Blancos this season.

Real Madrid have been defeated against CSKA Moscow, Levante, Barcelona and now Eibar, with all of those teams wearing blue and red.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/11/24/5bf98197268e3ed1218b45fc.html

Isco, Mariano and Llorente: Three of Solari's decisions that are hard to understand


It can't be denied that Santiago Solari has made decisions since being promoted to take the reins of the Real Madrid first team. Vinicius, Dani Ceballos and Javi Sanchez have all been included and Keylor Navas has had his Champions League place taken by Thibaut Courtois.

In the hours leading up to the Eibar game he insisted along the same line. None of his three decisions were the reasons behind the defeat, but they combine to cast doubt on the management.

Isco is left on the bench
Mariano not in the squad
Marcos Llorente is discarded

Hazard on Madrid: "If I don't renew, it's possible next summer"

The Belgian's contract expires in 2020 and he says he will not leave Chelsea in January but could leave in the summer for Real Madrid if he doesn't renew.

Eden Hazard continues to be linked with a move to Real Madrid and while he has started the year well with Chelsea, his contract negotiations will decide whether he stays or goes. In an interview with Canal+ France, he spoke about his possible exit if his renewal is not forthcoming.

"In January, I will still have a year of my contract," he said. "But If I don't renew, a move is possible. Next summer is a possibility but it is also possible that I will spend the rest of my career at Chelsea."

January departure out of the question for Hazard

He did, however, rule out a move during the winter market. "I don't see myself leaving Chelsea in January, I wouldn't do it to the fans or the club," he admitted.

The Belgian also admitted that "I have contacts with PSG but they didn't appeal to me, I have always said that if I return to Ligue 1, it will be to go to Lille."

LaLiga without VAR: Barcelona top, Real Madrid still 6th


The video assistant referee system has altered decisions in three games in LaLiga week 13.

With one game still to be played on LaLiga matchday 13, the video assistant referee (VAR) system has intervened as many as four times this weekend.

Eibar's 3-0 win over Real Madrid saw VAR give the hosts' opening goal, scored by Gonzalo Escalante, after it had initially been ruled out for offside; in Valencia's 3-0 victory over Rayo Vallecano, referee Pablo González Fuertes incorrectly booked Bebe for a foul committed by Luis Advíncula, before being told of his error and showing the Peruvian what was his second yellow card; and in Huesca and Levante's 2-2 draw at El Alcoraz, a Xabier Etxeita strike for the home side was disallowed for offside after a video review, and Emmanuel Boateng's effort for the visitors was chalked off for the same infringement before being reinstated.

Totti: "In some parallel universe, I was Sergio Ramos' captain"

The former AS Roma player explains in his biography as to how Florentino Perez tried to secure his signature on two occasions.

Tonight ahead of Roma v Real Madrid Champions League match, former "capitano" of the Giallorossi, Francesco Rossi is set to be inducted into the AS Roma 'Hall of Fame'.

In his recent biography 'Un Capitano' written by journalist Paolo Condó it outlines on the two occasions that Real Madrid president Florentino Perez attempted to lure Totti from the "Eternal City" to don the white shirt of Madrid at the Santiago Bernabeu.

Not to be deterred, in 2004, Florentino, once again attempted to secure the services of the central player. At the time Totti had just one year left on his contract with the then "Galacticos" Beckham and Zidane telling the Roma player that he'd soon be joining them in the Spanish capital. Totti was earning 5.8 million euro with the club from the capital and Fiorentino offered the player a 12 million plus a lucrative image rights deal. "It was crazy claims Totti in the book, I was set to become the best paid player in the world with Madrid poised to offload Figo so the No.10 shirt would be mine".

Ultimately in a time of short term deals and questionable loyalty in the game, Totti stated: "I won't commit treason on my people, I won't go to Madrid and will write my history with Roma". In his final match with the Roma shirt at the Bernabeu he received a standing ovation from the home fans and changed shirts with Sergio Ramos". He recalls the moment in the book stating: "Ramos has been with Madrid since 2005, the year when I was poised to join. In some parallel universe, I would have been his captain...".

https://en.as.com/en/2018/11/27/football/1543320693_705355.html

Capello: Real Madrid are worse, Roma can beat them

During his time in coaching, Fabio Capello took the reins at both Real Madrid and Roma and the Italian believes that the Eusebio Di Francesco's side have the edge and can win in the Stadio Olimpico on Tuesday night.

"Maybe Madrid [are worse], they are paying the price for thinking that they could get results without Cristiano Ronaldo," he said.

Real Madrid eye Man City wantaway Diaz

Midfielder will be available for free in June

Brahim Diaz has decided he will not renew his contract with Manchester City amid interest from Real Madrid.

Despite three appearances in cup competitions this term, the 19-year-old has not featured in the Premier League since the end of 2017-18.

His contract runs out at the end of the season and he has decided it is time to go and Cadena SER says Madrid will try to sign him in January, but may have to wait until the summer to get him.

Solari on leaving out Isco: There are specific decisions for specific moments

Real Madrid were aware of their progression through to the knockout phase of the Champions League prior to kick-off, yet first place was still up for grabs and Santiago Solari surprised many by leaving Isco out of his squad.

"There are specific decisions for specific moments," he explained in his post-match press conference after the 2-0 win.

"We are making decisions and that's it, they are almost always sporting except in rare cases, but that doesn't apply here.

"We're here to give everything and who starts and who is on the bench is a fictitious problem that doesn't exist."

Courtois chooses the best three keepers in the world

Real Madrid and Belgian keeper has chosen the three best keepers in the world, and hasn't included himself.

"Ter Stegen, Alisson and Oblak", responded Courtois. "They are all great goalkeepers, but I do not know who the best is. I could not go for one, that depends on the defence and also on the whole team, I think I have already shown that I am at a high level.”

https://en.as.com/en/2018/11/28/football/1543414322_083629.html

Real Madrid's Champions League record


After their victory in Rome to qualify mathematically for the next phase of the Champions League, Real Madrid set another record in the European competition.

Barcelona, Bayern Munich, Ajax, Manchester City, Roma, Juventus and Manchester United have also been guaranteed a presence in the Round of 16.

It means that Real are the team that has qualified from the group stage the most times.

They've achieved it on 23 occasions, the last 22 consecutively, and since the 1997/98 season they haven't failed to do so.

In addition, between the 1999/00 and 2002/03 campaigns, the competition format meant that all the teams that passed the first group had to play a second.

https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/11/28/5bfea92d468aeb4a1d8b4668.html

Marcelo: I'm not saying Isco hasn't worked, but football is like that

After Real Madrid's match against Roma, Marcelo spoke about Isco being dropped by Santiago Solari for the fixture.

"I am not the one to give advice, we are older, we are parents, we know what we have to do," he said to Real Madrid TV.

"All the players want to play, but we have to work and that's what all the players have done.

"I'm not saying Isco hasn't worked, but football is like that and you have to see what you're failing at and improve."

Real Madrid recover at Valdebebas and look ahead to Valencia game


Valencia await Real Madrid this Saturday evening and, as such, there is no rest this week for Santiago Solari's players.

The squad were back at work on Wednesday and had a recovery session after their 2-0 win over Roma on Tuesday night.

The starters recovered in the gym, although Luka Modric, Toni Kroos, Marcos Llorente and Lucas Vazquez also did some jogging on the pitch.

Also doing some running were Jesus Vallejo and Alvaro Odriozola, as they recover from their recent injuries, while Nacho, Casemiro and Sergio Reguilon continued their own recovery processes.

Castilla players Javi Sanchez, Jaime Seoane and Fidalgo also took part in the day's workout.

Tottenham demand 250 million euros for Real Madrid's Modric replacement


Even though it is likely that Luka Modric will win the Ballon d'Or on Monday, Real Madrid know he is not eternal and are already lining up his replacement, which is not proving easy.

Top of their list is Tottenham's Christian Eriksen, but the Premier League side's demands are crazy.

Daniel Levy won't budge though, and he is demanding 250 million euros to lure his Danish gem away from north London.
